name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - List snapshot repositories
description: This section explains how to list the snapshot repositories available in an Elasticsearch cluster using a curl command. A snapshot repository is a location where Elasticsearch can store backups of data and cluster state. Listing the repositories allows users to view the available backup locations before taking a snapshot or restoring data.
use_cases: Preparing to restore data from a snapshot

name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - Take a snapshot
description: This section explains how to create a snapshot of the Elasticsearch data and retrieve the status or progress of the snapshot creation process. A snapshot is a backup of the Elasticsearch data at a specific point in time, which can be used for data recovery or migration purposes.

name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - Get snapshot status (progress)
description: This section explains how to retrieve the status or progress of a snapshot operation in Elasticsearch using a curl command. The command allows you to check the details of a specific snapshot, such as its current state (in progress, successful, or failed), the number of files processed, and other relevant information. This can be useful for monitoring long-running snapshot operations or troubleshooting issues.

name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - Get snapshot details
description: This section provides a command to retrieve details of a specific snapshot stored in an Elasticsearch snapshot repository. It allows users to view information about a snapshot, such as its creation date, size, and the indices included in the snapshot. This can be useful for monitoring and managing snapshots, which are backups of Elasticsearch data for disaster recovery or migration purposes.

name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - Restore a snapshot
description: This section explains how to restore a previously taken snapshot of an Elasticsearch cluster from a specified snapshot repository. The provided command is a cURL request that initiates the restore process by sending a POST request to the Elasticsearch cluster's API endpoint. The restore operation retrieves the data from the specified snapshot and restores it to the cluster, effectively recovering the cluster's state to the point when the snapshot was taken.
use_cases: Recovering data after a disaster or system failure
Testing or development purposes, where a known state of the cluster is required
Reverting changes or rolling back to a previous version of the data

name: Elasticsearch Frequently used APIs.txt - Cluster Health
description: This section provides a command to check the overall health status of an Elasticsearch cluster. It also mentions two potential use cases: retrieving the health status of a single index, and draining a node (possibly for maintenance or load balancing purposes).
use_cases: Checking health of a specific index
Draining a node for maintenance or load balancing
